description:
In requirements.txt, I can see:
six<1.4.0

However, after removing this restriction, there is no unit test that fails. And Debian Sid has python-six 1.4.1-1.

Please remove this useless restriction, since otherwise, I have to add a patch in debian/patches to fix that.
title: Nova uselessly restrict the version of six

comments.content:
In requirements.txt, I can see:
six<1.4.0

However, after removing this restriction, there is no unit test that fails. And Debian Sid has python-six 1.4.1-1.

Please remove this useless restriction, since otherwise, I have to add a patch in debian/patches to fix that.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~thomas-goirand

comments.content: Thomas, are you asking this change for Havana or current Trunk?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content: While my tests were with Havana (building in Sid the RC1 release before upload to Debian Experimental), this should happen in both branches.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~thomas-goirand

comments.content: While my tests were with Havana (building in Sid the RC1 release before upload to Debian Experimental), this should happen in both branches.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~thomas-goirand

comments.content:
six is unbounded in the latest requirements.txt


commit 3f908c9c6073a7e326e0ec96fedc410ad8191f83
Author: OpenStack Jenkins <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Oct 1 16:13:56 2013 +0000

    Updated from global requirements

--- a/requirements.txt
+++ b/requirements.txt
@@ -25,7 +25,7 @@ python-cinderclient>=1.0.5
 python-neutronclient>=2.3.0,<3
 python-glanceclient>=0.9.0
 python-keystoneclient>=0.3.2
-six<1.4.0
+six
 stevedore>=0.10
 websockify>=0.5.1,<0.6
 oslo.config>=1.2.0
